bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED CIRCUIT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin and Sister Angelique for a Writ of Certiorari} No. 1078 Order

On reading and filing the mandate of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in this cause, bearing date the 4th day of December, 1903, and in obedience to say mandate, and in organization with the opinion of the said United States Circuit Court of Appeals, it is hereby ordered, adjudgment and decreed that the order and judgment made in said cause on the 19th day of February, 1903, and the order and judgment made in said cause on the 5th day of March, 1903, be and each of them is hereby vacated and set aside.
And it is further ordered and adjudged that the writ of habeas corpus issued in this matter on the 13th day of February, 1903, be and the same is hereby quashed.
And it is further ordered and sdjudged that the appellees be, and they are hereby remanded to the custody of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector.
Done in open Court this 7th day of January. 1904.
Due and full service of within acknowledged this day of, 189 Attorney for
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Division.
THE UNITED STATES VS. Jame Jas P. Larvin
FILED IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JAN 7 1904 A. REEVES AVRES, Clerk HMSStatiherd Deputy
Wilson R. Gay, UNITED STATES ATTORNEY, SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
